benefits.title: Risk of Kidney Stones
benefits.description: A low oxalate diet reduces the risk of calcium oxalate kidney stones by decreasing the amount of oxalate available to bind with calcium in the kidneys, thereby preventing crystal formation.

benefits.title: Better Mineral Absorption
benefits.description: Lowering oxalate intake allows the body to better absorb calcium and other minerals, as high oxalate levels compete with these nutrients in the digestive system.

benefits.title: Less Gut Distress
benefits.description: Eating less oxalate can improve digestion for those who experience bloating and gut distress.

benefits.title: Better Management of Chronic Conditions
benefits.description: Reducing oxalate intake can be beneficial for conditions like hyperoxaluria and inflammatory bowel diseases, such as Crohnâ€™s.

benefits.title: Low Oxalate Help For People With Kidney Disease
benefits.description: Individuals with impaired kidney function can benefit from a low-oxalate diet because their kidneys cannot effectively excrete oxalates.
